newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech cbank sets one-wk rev repo at max 45 pct.
newsitem.headline: Czech cbank sets one-wk rev repo at max 45 pct.

text.p: The Czech National Bank (CNB) said on Tuesday it would hold a one-week reverse repo tender to drain liquidity from the market at a maximum rate of 45 percent, unchanged from its previous rate on Monday.
The CNB said it would accept two bids from participants of a minimum 100 million crowns until 9.45 a.m. (0745 GMT).
The CNB held two one week repo tenders on Monday, with average yield hitting 44.98 percent and 45 percent respectively. The previous CNB rate was 75 percent.
The central bank has been holding several tenders daily in the past weeks in order to drain liquidity from the market and help support the crown.

The CNB has restricted banks from access to Lombard credit, after raising it to 50 percent from 14 percent. It has also limited foreign banks' access to the money market and raised its discount rate to 13 percent from 10.5 percent.
